alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 29 at 9:42PM EST until February 01 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. White River from Edwardsport to Hazleton. .Minor flooding will continue on the East Fork White at Seymour until Tuesday morning. Minor lowland flooding will continue at Edwardsport and develop over the next couple of days at Petersburg and Hazleton on the White River and last through the week. The crest on the White is near Elliston. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Edwardsport. * WHEN...Until late Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Flooding of low agricultural fields begin. Daviess CR 375 WN and North River Rd in Knox County located inside the levees are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Monday /6:00 PM CST Monday/ the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 15.3 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Tuesday afternoon by around 1245 PM EST /1145 AM CST/.
